meanings.definition: Having neatly trimmed and well-groomed nails.
meanings.sent1: Her manicured nails sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: She always keeps her nails manicured for special occasions.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to mimic her manicured nails by scratching the furniture.
meanings.sent4: The manicured garden resembled a work of art.
meanings.sent5: The manicured nails added elegance to her overall look.

meanings.definition: To trim or care for (nails, hands, or plants) in a neat and tidy manner.
meanings.sent1: She manicured her nails before the party.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys manicuring the plants in his garden every weekend.
meanings.sent3: The barber accidentally manicured his own finger instead of the customer's nail.
meanings.sent4: She meticulously manicured the bonsai tree, shaping it into a miniature masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The landscaper manicured the bushes to perfection, creating a beautiful display.
